ygData.subject: Re: Anger 2 Rage!
ygData.msgSnippet: Tavatron fired a few more optics blasts at Catgut before turning to face Dinobot once again. His words still echoed in her ears, causing her to plaster them

From: "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@...>

Tavatron fired a few more optics blasts at Catgut before turning to face 
Dinobot once again. His words still echoed in her ears, causing her to 
plaster them against her head to the point where they were nearly invisible. 
Her growl had become a threatening snarl, just daring Dinobot to push her 
further. She didn't need this. Just because she was a femme didn't mean she 
was a slaggin' weakling! Even the most experienced warrior could be taken 
down when faced with a greater number of enemies, as she had been when 
Zardus and his Alliance minions had captured her:

"And I suppose YOU'RE the only one who can risk his neck saving others?! 
What if I had been the one blasted by Obliteratron?! Would it had made a 
SLAGGIN' DIFFERENCE?!

As for the ALLIANCE, we were surrounded and greatly outnumbered! Not all of 
us are TRANSMETALS! I guess unlike YOU, who can't seem to keep his armor in 
one piece(!), I was captured! THIS IS A WAR!

SO GET ON THE SLAGGIN' DRAGON(no offense Necromancer^_^) DINOBOT!"

Tavatron clenched her teeth as she felt herself slipping further from 
reality. During her rage she had unknowingly activaed a darker, more 
sinister form of her programming. She rarely used it now, since many had 
died as a result of it in the past, both friend and foe.

The only outer showings of this programming her friends had jokingly dubbed 
'night vision', was a slow, steady change in eye color. Her optics would go 
from a normal crimson to a dark, shining black. It began on the edges of her 
eyes and slowly worked it's way to her optic center. The result was total 
blindness and enhancement of all of her remaining senses 100 fold. Her 
strength, speed, stamina, all where amplified to the point of Transmetal 
like strength, coupled with an emotionless state that left her prey no 
chance of begging.

Whomever she happened to be looking at was registered as the intended 
target, and destroyed. Whether at close range or from afar, it didn't make a 
difference. Death was inevitable. The only way to break the programming once 
it was activated was to her objective: Anihalation of whomever had been in 
her sights. Unfortunetly Dinobot just happened to be the one she was glaring 
at, and the program had snuck up on her in such a way as to make it nearly 
impossible to notice or pull out of in time.

As Tavatron's hearing intensified it keyed in on Dinobot's systems. She 
could hear his spark pulsing, a sound that would plague her until she 
silenced it. All part of the experimental programming. A crushing sound of 
sorts, small but noticible, made Tavatron twitch her ears and momentarily 
brought her back to reality. Her vision was darkened, but she could still 
see the partial image of DInobot slumped against an extremely large lizard.

Suddenly, with a gasp of shock and instant righting of her ears she realized 
what was happening. She had activated experimental program 3462, and was 
very close to completely keying in on Dinobot! She shut her optics in a 
frantic attempt to slow her rising anger and hate, yet another byproduct of 
the program.

With much effort she pushed it back, her vision returning to normal as she 
walked towards Dinobot. She glared at him, a certain degree of anger in her 
optics. If he wanted to argue this out, then that was fine by her, but she 
would wait until they were back at base and under more controlled 
conditions. Dinobot had no idea just how close he had come to death. In his 
current state he didn't stand a chance against her in kill mode. If he had 
been fully healed, however, he most likely would've ended up having to kill 
her. It would have been for the best. She had seen what happened to 'bots 
who were trapped in the program. They ended up either catatonic or in mental 
institutions. She had no desire for either of the two:

"Perhaps a ride back would be for the best."

Tavatron's voice was cold and emotionless as she clambered aboard 
Necromancer and waited for Dinobot to do the same. She knew he was in pain, 
but right now she didn't give a slag. She was too upset over the fact that 
the programming still existed after all these years. Besides, if they flew 
back to base Dinobot would get there in plenty of time to make it to an 'R 
chamber.
